member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData
member.summary: Represents a per shape data that NOV Diagram layouts can optionally use.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.DockArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the dock area of the shape. The Dock layout uses this value to determine the area to which to dock the shape. Applicable to 2D shapes only. By default set to Top.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.WrapFlowBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets whether flow layouts should break after this shape. The WrapFlow and Table layouts uses this value to determine whether they should make a new lane after the shape. Applicable to 2D shapes only. By default false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.IndexInLayer
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the vertex in the layer.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.LayerIndex
member.summary: Determines layer index of the node when Layered Graph Layout is applied. By default set to -1, which means that the index will be determined automatically.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.TipOverChildrenPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the way in which the TipOver tree layout arranges the shape children. Applicable only to 2D shapes. By default set to Row.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.XMoveable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether force directed layouts are allowed to move the shape in the X direction. Applicable to 2D shapes only. By default true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.YMoveable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether force directed layouts are allowed to move the shape in the Y direction. Applicable to 2D shapes only. By default true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.MagnetizationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of magnetization of the 1D shape. Applicable only to 1D shapes.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.ElectricalCharge
member.summary: Gets or sets the ellectrical charge of the shape. In Spring Graph Layouts this affects the strength with which vertex repels other vertices. Applicable to 2D Shapes only.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.SpringStiffness
member.summary: Gets or sets the spring stiffness of the shape. In Spring Graph Layouts this affects the strength with which edge repels or attracts the connected vertices. Applicable to 1D Shapes only.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.SpringLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the spring length of the shape. In Spring Graph Layouts this affects the natural length of the spring. The layout tries to arrange the vertices connected by this edge at this distance. Applicable to 1D Shapes only.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NLayoutData.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass of the shape. In Force Directed Layouts this affects the strength with which vertex is attracted to the current barycenter of the graph. Applicable to 2D Shapes only.

member.summary: Represents a shape, the geometry of which can avoid obstacles (other shapes) in its path.

member.summary: Occurs when the connector needs to create a path from the base routing points.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.RerouteMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode in which this route is automatically rerouted. Only taken into account if the ShapeType property is set to Shape1D.
member.remarks: By default set to Never

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets model that defines this connector geometry.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.AllowLayoutsReroute
member.summary: Gets or sets whether layouts are allowed to reroute the connector. By default set to true.
member.remarks: Typically each layout has some predefined routing logic. That is why when routable connectors that allow reroute are routed by the layout, their RerouteMode is set to Never, and their model is defined by the layout. If you wish to protect a specific connector from this default behavior, you can set this property to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.UpdatingGeometry
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the geoemtry is currently being updated.

member.summary: Overriden to include the bounds of the model points.

member.summary: Translates a 1D shape, by offseting the begin and end points of the shape. The modification of both the begin and end points of the shape is optional. Overriden to translate the model points too. Throws an exception if this is not a 1D shape.

member.remarks: This implementation returns true if the graph edge is not reflexive and the edge is connected to a routing service
member.returns: true if it can reroute, otherwise false

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.RequestReroute
member.summary: Requests the finding of a new route of this connector, which strives not to cross any obstacles.

member.summary: Determines whether the route can currently be rerouted
member.remarks: This implementation returns true if the graph edge is not reflexive and the edge is connected to a routing service
member.returns: true if it can reroute, otherwise false

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NRoutableConnector.Reroute
member.summary: Finds of a new route of this connector, which strives not to cross any obstacles.

member.summary: Updates the geometry of the connector from its model. Automatically called by Nevron.

member.summary: Gets a list with the intersection points of this connector with the given connector in page coordinates. If the connectors do not intersect an empty list is returned.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.SetPinPoint(Nevron.Nov.Graphics.NPoint)
member.summary: Sets the pin point position (in parent coordinates). This operation unglues the shape from its master (if any). If the shape resides in a group, the Pin is expressed as factor expressions of the group dimensions. If the shape resides in a page, the Pin is set to constant values.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.SetPinPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the pin point position (in parent coordinates). This operation unglues the shape from its master (if any). If the shape resides in a group, the Pin is expressed as factor expressions of the group dimensions. If the shape resides in a page, the Pin is set to constant values.
member.param: New pin point X position (in parent coordinates).
New pin point Y position (in parent coordinates).

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.SetAngle(Nevron.Nov.NAngle)
member.summary: Sets the shape angle relatively to its parent (i.e. Page or Group). This operation unglues the shape from its master (if any). If the shape is inside the page, this method sets a constant value to the Angle property. If the shape is inside a group, this method also updates the expressions of the Width and Height properties, depending on the ResizeInGroup setting.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.Rotate(Nevron.Nov.NAngle)
member.summary: Rotates the shape with the specified angle amount. Internally this method calls SetAngle with a value equal to Angle + angle.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.GlueMasterPortToPort(Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort,Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort)
member.summary: Glues (connects) a port of this shape to a port of the master shape. This type of glue translates the shape to match the port locations, and rotates the shape to match the port directions.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.UnglueFromMaster
member.summary: Unglues (disconnects) the outward connection of this shape if any.

remarks.para: The outward connection for a shape controls the shape PinX, PinY and Angle properties by binding them to the aspect and element defined by the MasterElementRef and MasterGlue properties.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.Init1DShape(Nevron.Nov.Diagram.EN1DShapeXForm)
member.summary:
Helper method for setting up a 1D shape. Sets the ShapeType to 1D.
If xformType is Vector, the shape transform is initialized as a vector connecting the begin and end points, such that: Binds the Width to the distance between the Begin and End points. Binds the Angle to the angle formed by the line connecting the Begin and End points and the X axis. Binds the PinX and PinY to the middle point of the line connecting the Begin and End points. Binds the LocPinX and LocPinY to the center of the shape local alignment box.
If xformType is Box, the shape transform is initialized as a vector connecting the begin and end points, such that: Binds the Width to the X distance between the Begin and End points. Binds the Height to the Y distance between the Begin and End points. Sets the angle to zero. Binds the PinX and PinY to the middle point of the line connecting the Begin and End points. Binds the LocPinX and LocPinY to the center of the shape.

member.summary: Gets the begin point of the shape (in parent coordinates)

member.summary: Gets the begin point of the shape in page coordinates

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.GetBeginPointInDrawing
member.summary: Gets the begin point of the shape in drawing coordinates

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NShape.SetBeginPoint(Nevron.Nov.Graphics.NPoint)

member.summary: Gets or sets the mode in which the port direction angle is determined. By default set to custom.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort.DirX
member.summary: Determines the x-component for the required alignment vector of a matching port

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort.DirY
member.summary: Determines the y-component for the required alignment vector of a matching port

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort.Relative
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the port coordinates are expressed in absolute or relative values. By default set to false, meaning that port coordinates are in absolute shape coordinates.
member.remarks:
It is often required to make ports the coordinates of which are expressed relatively to the shape Width and Height. In such cases you may set the Relative property to true.
For example: if Relative is set to false, to define a port in the center of the shape you can set the "Width*0.5" and "Height*0.5" expressions to the X and Y coordindates of the port. This syntax requires one expressions per port coordinate.
if Relative is set to true, to define a port in the center of the shape you can set the X property to 0.5 and the Y property to 0.5. This syntax does not require expressions.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NPort.GlueMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the port glue mode, which defines the way in which this port can glue to other shapes ports and whether other shapes end-points are allowed to glue to this port. By default set to .

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NTextBlockContent.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Determines whether to add the predefined styles to the document block or not.

Specifies whether to add default document styles to this document, i.e. styles that are applied to all paragraphs, inlines and tables in the document. The names of these styles are null and that is why they get applied to all elements of the specific type.

member.summary: Specifies whether coordinates should be snapped to the rulers. By default set to true

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.SnapToGrid
member.summary: Specifies whether coordinates should be snapped to the grid. By default set to true

member.summary: Specifies whether coordinates should be snapped to guidelines. By default set to true

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.SnapToGeometries
member.summary: Specifies whether to snap to geometries. By default set to true

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.SnapToPorts
member.summary: Specifies whether to snap to shape ports. By default set to true

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.SnapToShapes
member.summary: Specifies whether to snap to shapes. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GlueToShapes
member.summary: Specifies whether points can be be glued to shapes. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GlueToGeometries
member.summary: Specifies whether points can be glued to geometries. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GlueToPorts
member.summary: Specifies whether points can be be glued to ports. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.RulersStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the rulers ticks attracts coordinates (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 4

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GridStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the grid lines attracts coordinates (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 5

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GuidelinesStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the guidelines attracts coordinates (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 10

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GeometryStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the geometry outline attract points (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 8

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.GeometryVerticesStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the geometry vertices attract points (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 8

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.PortsStrength
member.summary: Specifies the strength (area) in which the ports attract points (in pixels)
member.remarks: By default set to 10

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.SnapRotation
member.summary: Specifies whether rotation angles must be snapped. By default set to true

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.RotationTolerance
member.summary: Controls the tolerance, under which the snapping of the rotation angles occurs. By default set to 5 degrees.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.NSnapAndGlue.RotationStep
member.summary: Controls the step to which rotation angles are snapped. 360 degrees must be divisible to the specified value. By default set to 45 degrees.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.DrawingTools.NDragHandleTool.OnAborted
member.summary: Overriden to call the CancelDragging method of the dragged handle and reset the reference to it.

member.summary: Moves the preview of the selected items to the position specified by dragPos. If preview is not created, it is created if the mustCreatePreview is true, or the mouse has moved a certain amount from the tool activation position. Finally if the preview is created, it is started with the location specified by startPos parameter.

position to start preview from (in page coordinates)

member.summary: Gets the item permissions mask or simply the mask of operations that the user can perform with the item. The permissions mask is calculated as the item Abilities minus the item Protection. Operations dealing with diagram items always check the items permissions. Certain diagram items may additionally drop certain permissions as they see fit.

member.summary: Sets the protection properties of this item to reflect the specified protection mask.
member.remarks: This method sets values to the protection properties of this item that are exposed. For example if the you call SetProtectionMask(ENDiagramItemOperationMask.MoveX), this will allow all operations to the item, except MoveX.

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor
member.summary: A theme color that depends on a color from the theme color palette.
member.remarks: When the Name of the dynamic theme color is set to VariantColor, the scheme color uses the theme info and shape style related properties of their owner INStyleableElement to get a color from the proper variant palette.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.#ctor(Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.ENThemeColorName)
member.param: The theme color name, for example Dark1, Accent2, etc.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.Name
member.summary: Gets/Sets the theme color name of this scheme color.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.Tint
member.summary: Gets/Sets the tint of the color. Must be from 0 to 1. Larger values result in lighter colors.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.Shade
member.summary: Gets/Sets the shade of the color. Must be from 0 to 1. Larger values result in darker colors.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.SaturationModifier
member.summary: Gets/Sets the saturation modifier factor of the color. Can be any value. Larger values result in more saturated colors. By default set to 1, which means 100% saturation (i.e. the original color).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.LuminanceModifier
member.summary: Gets/Sets the luminance modifier factor of the color. Can be any value. Larger values result in lighter colors. By default set to 1, which means 100% lumininace (i.e. the originanl color).

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.Alpha
member.summary: Gets/Sets the alpha of the color. Must be from 0 to 1. 0 means a completely transparent color and 1 means a completely opaque color.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.ToColor(Nevron.Nov.Diagram.INStyleableElement)
member.summary: Converts this theme color to NColor.
member.param: The styleable element this theme color is used in, for example a shape or a style preview.
member.returns: The color equivalent of this theme color or NColor.Empty if a color equivalent couldn't be determined.

member.summary: Creates a dynamic theme color with the given tint and shade.

member.summary: Creates a dynamic theme color with the given saturation and luminance modifier factors.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.NDynamicThemeColor.CreateAlpha(Nevron.Nov.Diagram.Themes.ENThemeColorName,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a dynamic theme color with the given alpha modifier factor.
member.param: Alpha of the color. Must be from 0 to 1. 0 means a completely transparent color and 1 means a completely opaque color.
